      • hexEdgeRegionAt

        public int hexEdgeRegionAt(int x,
                  int y)
        This method returns the direction to the closest hex-edge at the given pixel coordinates
        Parameters:
        x - The X pixel coordinate
        y - The Y pixel coordinate
        Returns:
        A number between 0-5 where 0 is northeast, 5 is southeast

      • highlightIDs

        public void highlightIDs(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> hexes)
        highlight the set of given hexes. This adds to any previous highlights to unhighlight use clearHighlights Right now color is hardcoded, and you can't highlight multiple colors at once. This could change in the future.
        Parameters:
        hexes - A Set of hex IDs

      • highlight

        public void highlight(java.util.ArrayList<MapHex> hexes)
        highlight the set of given hexes. This adds to any previous highlights to unhighlight use clearHighlights Right now color is hardcoded, and you can't highlight multiple colors at once. This could change in the future.
        Parameters:
        hexes - A Set of hexes

      • highlight

        public void highlight(java.lang.String hex)
        highlight the given hex. Adds to any previous highlights.
        Parameters:
        hex - A hex ID to highlight

        Clear all currently highlighted hexes

      • clearHighlight

        public void clearHighlight(java.lang.String hex)

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This method draws the hexmap as part of the java swing drawing process. It draws everything it needs to in several passes, first hexes, then hex-edges, etc.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics2D object to draw on.

      • getScrollableUnitIncrement

        public int getScrollableUnitIncrement(java.awt.Rectangle visibleRect,
                             int orientation,
                             int direction)
        Return the rough amount to scroll for one unit amount This isn't perfect because it returns an integer, and doesn't keep track of leftover amounts. FIXME: JavaDoc generator doesn't recognize parameter Rectangle.
        Specified by:
        getScrollableUnitIncrement in interface javax.swing.Scrollable
        Parameters:
        visibleRect - the visible area, a Rectangle
        orientation - either SwingConstants.HORIZONTAL or SwingConstants.VERTICAL
        direction - currently unused. See java API docs for what it means
        Returns:
        the rough amount of pixelsto scroll for one unit amount
